entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 1:51PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW LIKELY THROUGH THE WEEKEND... A complex area of low pressure moving toward the region from the Gulf of Alaska will bring accumulating snow to the eastern Kenai Peninsula, mainly from Portage Valley to Moose Pass, for the weekend. An initial round of light snow showers will develop Saturday morning and could taper off briefly Saturday evening

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 12:26PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW LIKELY SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT... A complex area of low pressure moving toward the region from the Gulf of Alaska will bring accumulating snow to the Matanuska Valley, Anchorage Bowl, and Kenai Peninsula for the weekend. An initial round of light snow will develop Saturday night and could taper off briefly late Saturday night before a second round

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 3:19AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS THIS AFTERNOON... An anomalously dry airmass for early April will settle over the region today. This combined with northwest winds gusts from 25 to 30 mph will result in elevated fire weather concerns this afternoon.
